column4: I've noticed that with several very different computers and very different harddrives that Ubuntu, using reiserfs, tends to make a drive randomly reset and spin back up. Has anyone else experienced this? It doesn't seem to really affect that actual system, apart from a brief second of lag on occasion.
This has never happened to me in other distros.
using dapper or breezy?
Breezy only. I have a number of Dapper systems that don't have this problem.

have a look in /etc/laptop-mode/laptop-mode.conf under "hard drive behaviour settings". maybe there is a power-saving setting there that is messing it up (for example, a 2 second time out before the HDD spins down instead of a more sane setting)
Alright. I'll take a look.
I don't have laptop mode installed.
well, that counts that out at least :) so an acpi setting? where are those located again... hmm...
I could go through xscreensaver's GUI. :P
not a sign of that being in xscreensaver's thing. Anywhere else I can check?
/etc/acpi something.... but I honestly thought it was the laptop-mode causing this (had that prob two weeks ago)
you may find that it wasn't that for you, either. :P
laptop-mode.conf solved it for me, but it might be another cause for you it seems. sorry if I'm a bit vague
not a problem.
i thought of something, if it isn't sorted yet. there is also possibility to install "gnome-power-manager" and set HDD timeouts in there.
thanks for the tip. I'll look into that.
I forgot to mention that it did this even when the machine was very active...
then I have to say I don't really know what's going on
do you have at least 3gb free space on / ?
or is this before the install has begun?
this is before.
did you burn the cd yourself? is the md5sum ok?
I've used two copies, the md5sum is fine, and I used the same CD to install Ubuntu on this later model iMac.
then I do not know
